intro: Acmispon junceus var. biolettii, commonly known as the biolettii blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers in shades of blue or purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. This species is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
